definition: The time, place, and circumstances in which something occurs.
examples: This kind of teamwork often leads to deeper connections than we form in other settings.
The story takes place in a rural setting.
notes: 'Setting' ortam, bağlam, koşullar demektir. Çoğul haliyle farklı ortamları ifade eder.

definition: To meet socially or gather for a shared activity.
examples: Let’s get together for coffee sometime.
We usually get together with friends on weekends.
notes: Bir araya gelmek, sosyal amaçlı buluşmak anlamındadır.

definition: To unite or work as a group, often toward a common goal.
examples: People came together to support the victims.
The team came together and won the game.
notes: Bir araya gelmek, birleşmek, ortak bir amaç için toplanmak.

word: had our families meet each other
definition: To cause someone to do something; this is a causative structure using 'have'.
examples: We even had our families meet each other.
They had the mechanic check the car before the trip.
notes: ‘Have + object + verb’ yapısı başkasına bir şey yaptırmak anlamındadır. (Causative structure)

definition: To have a formal or planned meeting with someone.
examples: I met with the manager to discuss the proposal.
She met with her advisor to go over the schedule.
notes: Genellikle iş veya resmi konular için kullanılır.

definition: To come into contact with someone, either planned or by chance.
examples: I met her at a conference.
Have you ever met a celebrity?
notes: Biriyle tanışmak ya da karşılaşmak anlamındadır. 'With' kullanılmaz.

definition: The money earned from an event or activity.
examples: Part of the proceeds goes towards a charitable cause.
All proceeds from the concert will go to charity.
notes: 'Proceeds' gelir, kazanç anlamına gelir ve her zaman çoğul olarak kullanılır.

definition: Related to giving help to those in need.
examples: They donated to a charitable foundation.
Charitable organizations help the poor and sick.
notes: Hayırsever, yardım amaçlı demektir.

definition: Showing sympathy and concern for others’ suffering.
examples: She is a compassionate nurse who cares for her patients deeply.
He offered a compassionate response to the tragedy.
notes: Şefkatli, merhametli anlamındadır.

definition: The process of improving something.
examples: They worked for the betterment of the community.
Education plays a key role in social betterment.
notes: İyileştirme, gelişme anlamındadır.

definition: A clever tactic used to attract customers or promote a product.
examples: It turned out to be just a marketing ploy.
Giving free samples is a common marketing ploy.
notes: Pazarlama taktiği, dikkat çekici strateji.

definition: Attractive or interesting to a particular person or group.
examples: The marketing ploy was aimed at appealing to people in their 20s.
This style of music is appealing to younger audiences.
notes: 'Appealing to' ilgisini çekmek, cazip gelmek anlamındadır.

definition: A purpose or organization focused on helping others in need.
examples: The fundraiser supported a charitable cause.
Many people donate to charitable causes during the holidays.
notes: Yardım amaçlı faaliyet veya kuruluş, hayır işi.

definition: To prove that a statement or theory is wrong or false.
examples: The scientist refuted the old theory with new evidence.
She refuted his claim with clear facts.
notes: 'Refute', çürütmek, yanlış olduğunu kanıtlamak anlamındadır.

definition: To weaken or damage something gradually or secretly.
examples: Constant criticism can undermine a person's confidence.
The scandal undermined the politician's credibility.
notes: 'Undermine', zayıflatmak, baltalamak anlamına gelir; genellikle gizli veya dolaylı yollarla olur.

definition: Powerful arguments or responses that effectively contradict or disprove a claim.
examples: The lawyer presented compelling rebuttals to the accusations.
Her essay included compelling rebuttals to opposing views.
notes: 'Rebuttal' bir iddiaya karşı güçlü cevap/çürütmedir. 'Compelling' burada 'inandırıcı, güçlü' anlamındadır.

definition: To become calm, relaxed, or stable; to begin to live a quieter and more regular life.
examples: The children finally settled down after the excitement.
He decided to settle down and start a family.
notes: Sakinleşmek, düzene girmek veya yerleşmek anlamındadır.

definition: To encourage or activate a process or function.
examples: Melatonin release is stimulated by darkness.
Caffeine can stimulate brain activity.
notes: Uyarmak, harekete geçirmek anlamındadır.

definition: To slow down or prevent a process or reaction.
examples: Melatonin release is inhibited by light.
Fear can inhibit performance during public speaking.
notes: Engellemek, baskılamak anlamındadır.

definition: The quality of being attentive and ready to respond.
examples: Lack of sleep affects mental alertness.
Drivers must maintain alertness on long trips.
notes: Uyanıklık, dikkatli olma durumu.

definition: The arrival or beginning of something important; in this case, electric lighting.
examples: The advent of the electric light changed how people sleep.
With the advent of the internet, communication has become easier.
notes: 'Advent' bir şeyin gelişi veya ortaya çıkışı anlamındadır.

definition: The state of being easy to use or suitable for a purpose.
examples: Online shopping offers great convenience.
People often choose convenience over health.
notes: Kolaylık, elverişlilik anlamına gelir.

definition: Related to the mind and mental processes.
examples: Sleep deprivation has psychological effects.
She received psychological support after the accident.
notes: Psikolojik, zihinsel süreçlerle ilgili.

definition: Related to the physical or biological functions of living organisms.
examples: Stress causes physiological changes in the body.
Sleep is essential for physiological recovery.
notes: Fizyolojik, bedenin işleyişiyle ilgili.

definition: Severe or intense; also can mean sharp or highly developed.
examples: She suffered from acute back pain.
Acute stress can lead to serious health problems.
notes: Şiddetli, yoğun, ani gelişen anlamına gelir.

definition: The condition of being very overweight in a way that is unhealthy.
examples: Obesity increases the risk of heart disease.
Childhood obesity is a growing concern worldwide.
notes: Aşırı şişmanlık, obezite durumu.

word: go behind the wheel of a car
definition: To drive a car.
examples: You shouldn’t go behind the wheel of a car when you’re tired.
He went behind the wheel despite having a suspended license.
notes: 'Behind the wheel' araba kullanmak anlamına gelir.

definition: The state of being affected by alcohol or drugs.
examples: Alcohol intoxication slows down reaction time.
He was arrested for driving under intoxication.
notes: Zehirlenme veya alkol/uyuşturucu etkisinde olma durumu.

definition: Used to say that something is likely or assumed to be true.
examples: Presumably, she missed the train and is running late.
The lights are off, so presumably no one is home.
notes: Muhtemelen, büyük ihtimalle anlamına gelir.

word: to go into orbit around it
definition: To start moving in a curved path around a planet or object in space.
examples: The satellite went into orbit around the Earth.
The spacecraft will go into orbit around Mars next week.
notes: 'Orbit' yörünge anlamına gelir. 'Go into orbit' bir cismin başka bir cismin çevresinde dönmeye başlaması demektir.

definition: Refers to the makeup or components of something.
examples: There are too many similarities in composition between Earth and the moon.
The composition of this rock includes various minerals.
notes: 'Composition' bir şeyin içeriği veya yapısı anlamındadır. 'In composition' ise 'yapısal olarak' veya 'bileşim bakımından' demektir.

definition: The process of splitting a nucleus into two or more parts, releasing energy.
examples: Nuclear fission is used in power plants to generate electricity.
Fission releases a large amount of energy.
notes: Nükleer fizikte bir çekirdeğin bölünmesi anlamına gelir. Fiziksel bilimlerde önemli bir terim.

definition: To continue existing or functioning separately from something else.
examples: The country remained independent from colonial rule.
The moon remained independent from the Earth after formation.
notes: 'Independent from' bağımsız olmak, bir şeyden etkilenmemek anlamına gelir.

definition: Scientists who study stars, planets, and other objects in space.
examples: Astronomers discovered a new planet last year.
Many astronomers use telescopes to observe distant galaxies.
notes: 'Astronomer' gökbilimci anlamındadır. Uzayla ilgili bilimsel çalışmaları yapan kişilerdir.

definition: To be hit suddenly and forcefully by something.
examples: Earth was struck by an object approximately one-tenth of its mass.
The car was struck by lightning during the storm.
notes: 'Strike' fiilinin geçmiş hali olan 'was struck by', bir şeyin aniden ve şiddetle vurulması anlamına gelir.

definition: To close or cause to close (usually windows or businesses).
examples: Many shops had to shutter during the economic crisis.
The old factory was shuttered last year.
notes: 'Shutter' genellikle dükkan ya da işletmelerin kapatılması anlamında kullanılır.

definition: To interrupt or disturb the normal course of something.
examples: Heavy rain disrupted the football match.
The new policy disrupted the usual workflow.
notes: Bir şeyin normal işleyişini bozmak, kesintiye uğratmak anlamındadır.

definition: To interrupt someone’s peace, rest, or concentration.
examples: Please don’t disturb me while I’m working.
The loud noise disturbed the students during the exam.
notes: Rahatsız etmek, huzuru bozmak anlamına gelir.

definition: To force someone or something to leave a place.
examples: The pilot ejected from the plane just before it crashed.
The machine ejected the faulty product.
notes: Bir şeyi zorla dışarı atmak, fırlatmak anlamındadır.

definition: To have a strong effect or influence on something.
examples: The new law will impact many businesses.
The asteroid impacted the Earth millions of years ago.
notes: Hem ‘çarpma, darbe’ anlamı hem de ‘etkilemek, etki yapmak’ anlamı vardır.

definition: Seeming reasonable or probable.
examples: It is more plausible that the Earth and the moon were never connected.
Her explanation was plausible, so everyone believed her.
notes: 'Plausible' mantıklı, akla yatkın, makul demektir.

definition: The outermost solid layer of the Earth.
examples: Earth’s crust is made of several large tectonic plates.
Volcanoes erupt through cracks in Earth’s crust.
notes: 'Crust' kabuk anlamına gelir, burada Dünya’nın en dış katmanı.

definition: Near or away from the coast or shore.
examples: There is an island off the western coast of the country.
The ship sank off the coast during the storm.
notes: 'Off' bir yerden biraz uzakta veya yakınında anlamında kullanılır.

definition: To separate something forcefully into pieces.
examples: The storm tore apart many houses along the coast.
The argument tore their friendship apart.
notes: 'Tear apart' parçalamak, yırtıp dağıtmak anlamındadır.

definition: To make something stronger, more solid, or more unified.
examples: The company consolidated its position in the market.
She tried to consolidate her notes before the exam.
notes: Güçlendirmek, sağlamlaştırmak, birleştirmek. Hem soyut şeyler (güç, bilgi, kontrol), hem de somut şeyler için kullanılabilir.

word: I know some Spanish, if that’s any consolation.
definition: Used to try to offer a small comfort or reassurance in an otherwise disappointing situation.
examples: I know some Spanish, if that’s any consolation.
We didn’t win, but at least we played well — if that’s any consolation.
notes: ‘If that’s any consolation’ ifadesi, ‘biraz teselli olursa, durumu hafifletirse’ anlamına gelir. Genellikle kötü bir haberi hafifletmeye çalışırken söylenir.

word: They must have let someone go before who isn’t a Spanish major, right?
definition: Expresses a logical assumption about the past — that at some point, a non-Spanish major must have been allowed to go.
examples: They must have let someone go before who isn’t a Spanish major, right?
He must have told them already — they look upset.
notes: ‘Must have + V3’ yapısı, geçmişte olmuş olma ihtimali çok yüksek olan bir şeyi ifade eder (mantıksal çıkarım). ‘Let someone go’ burada birini gitmesine izin vermek anlamında kullanılmıştır.

word: I can’t remember the last time a student was able to go who wasn’t a Spanish major.
definition: Used to express that something rarely (or never) happens — in this case, that non-Spanish majors almost never get the opportunity to go.
examples: I can’t remember the last time a student was able to go who wasn’t a Spanish major.
I can’t remember the last time it rained this hard in July.
notes: Bu ifade, nadiren gerçekleşen ya da uzun zamandır olmayan bir durumu vurgular. ‘Spanish major’ ifadesi, üniversitede ana dalı İspanyolca olan öğrenci anlamına gelir. Cümledeki 'who wasn’t a Spanish major' kısmı, önceki ‘student’ kelimesini tanımlar.

definition: Closely connected or appropriate to the matter at hand.
examples: Please only include information that is relevant to the topic.
Her comments were not relevant to the discussion.
notes: Konu ile ilgili, alakalı, yerinde. Genellikle 'relevant to' şeklinde kullanılır.

definition: To want something very much or be determined to achieve or get something.
examples: She has her heart set on studying abroad.
They have their hearts set on buying that house by the beach.
notes: Bir şeyi çok istemek, gönlünü bir şeye kaptırmak. Genellikle uzun zamandır arzu edilen şeyler için kullanılır.

word: Did you pick up your paper yet?
definition: A question asking if someone has collected or retrieved their document, assignment, or newspaper.
examples: Did you pick up your paper yet from the front desk?
I forgot to pick up my paper after class.
notes: ‘Pick up’ fiili burada ‘bir şeyi gidip almak, teslim almak’ anlamında kullanılır. ‘Paper’ kelimesi bağlama göre ‘gazete’, ‘ödev’ ya da ‘belge’ olabilir.

definition: To drive away or eliminate a thought, feeling, or belief.
examples: The other choices are mentioned at the beginning of the passage but later dispelled for various reasons.
The scientist tried to dispel the myth with evidence.
notes: Bir düşünceyi, şüpheyi veya yanılgıyı ortadan kaldırmak, dağıtmak. Genellikle soyut şeyler için kullanılır (örneğin: efsane, korku, şüphe).

definition: A story or an account of events, experiences, or the like, whether true or fictional.
examples: The topic is introduced, followed by an example and a historical narrative.
The documentary presents a compelling narrative of the war.
notes: Anlatı, öykü ya da olayların anlatımı. Akademik metinlerde 'historical narrative' gibi ifadelerle sıkça kullanılır.

definition: To have an average amount, level, or number over time.
examples: We average fewer than 7 hours of sleep per day by age 65.
Americans average about 3 cups of coffee per day.
notes: ‘We average’ ifadesi, ‘ortalama olarak ... oluruz/yaparız’ anlamında kullanılır. Burada ‘we average fewer than 7 hours’ demek, ‘ortalama olarak günde 7 saatten az uyuruz’ demektir.

definition: The condition of not having enough sleep.
examples: Sleep deprivation can lead to serious health problems.
College students often suffer from sleep deprivation during exam weeks.
notes: Yeterince uyuyamama durumu, uyku eksikliği.

word: I really wouldn't want you to get your hopes up.
definition: Used to warn someone not to expect too much, so they won’t be disappointed.
examples: I really wouldn't want you to get your hopes up — the position hasn’t been confirmed yet.
He said he might come, but I wouldn’t get my hopes up.
notes: ‘Get your hopes up’ ifadesi, ‘büyük umutlara kapılmak’ anlamına gelir. Bu cümlede ise birini fazla umutlandırmak istemediğini belirtir.

word: I can tell you put a lot of thought into this paper.
definition: An expression used to show that someone clearly made a strong effort or was very thoughtful while preparing something.
examples: I can tell you put a lot of thought into this paper. It's well-organized and insightful.
She smiled and said, 'I can tell you put a lot of thought into your gift.'
notes: Birinin yaptığı işe çok emek ve dikkat verdiğini belirtmek için kullanılır. 'put a lot of thought into' ifadesi, 'üzerinde çok düşünmek, özen göstermek' anlamına gelir.

definition: To leave behind or give up completely.
examples: He had to abandon the car in the snow.
They abandoned the plan due to budget issues.
notes: Often used in formal/legal contexts.

definition: Well meaning and kindly.
examples: She was a benevolent old lady who loved children.
notes: Positive connotation.

definition: To force someone to do something by using threats.
examples: He was coerced into signing the contract.
notes: Used especially in legal or political contexts.

definition: To go beyond the limits of something.
examples: Her music transcends cultural boundaries.
He tried to transcend his difficulties through meditation.
notes: Bir şeyin sınırlarını aşmak, üstüne çıkmak.

definition: The world experienced through the senses.
examples: We live in a sensory world full of sights and sounds.
Art can evoke the sensory world in vivid ways.
notes: Duyu organlarıyla deneyimlenen dünya.

definition: To achieve or reach something after effort.
examples: She attained her goals through hard work.
Many athletes attain greatness through dedication.
notes: Çaba sonucu ulaşmak, elde etmek.

definition: Expressing disapproval or judgment.
examples: The critics were critical of the new movie.
He was critical of the government's policies.
notes: Eleştirel olmak, bir şeyi beğenmemek.

definition: Behaving according to accepted standards or rules.
examples: She refused to follow social conformity.
Conformity can limit personal creativity.
notes: Toplumun ya da grubun kurallarına uyma.

word: art that stressed emotion over cold
definition: Art emphasizing feelings rather than logic or reason.
examples: Romantic art stressed emotion over cold rationality.
The painting reflects art that stressed emotion over cold techniques.
notes: Mantıktan çok duyguyu ön plana çıkaran sanat.

definition: To do the same things as someone before you, especially as a career.
examples: He followed in his father’s footsteps and became a doctor.
Many athletes follow in the footsteps of their idols.
notes: Birinin izinden gitmek, onun yaptığını yapmak.

definition: A theological seminary of Harvard University.
examples: Emerson studied at Harvard Divinity School.
Many religious leaders graduated from Harvard Divinity School.
notes: Harvard Üniversitesi'nin ilahiyat fakültesi.

definition: People ordained for religious duties, especially in Christian churches.
examples: The clergy led the Sunday service.
Many members of the clergy attended the conference.
notes: Din görevlileri, ruhban sınıfı.

definition: Concern with the human spirit or soul rather than material things.
examples: She practices meditation to deepen her spirituality.
Spirituality can bring peace and purpose.
notes: Maneviyat, ruhsal yön.

definition: Full of energetic and noisy activity.
examples: The bustling city streets were crowded with people.
We enjoyed the bustling market atmosphere.
notes: Canlı, hareketli ve gürültülü.

definition: To strongly encourage or persuade someone to do something.
examples: The teacher urged the students to study harder.
They urged him to accept the job offer.
notes: İkna etmek, ısrarla tavsiye etmek.

definition: To defeat or overcome with superior force.
examples: The army was able to overpower the enemy.
Fear can sometimes overpower reason.
notes: Güçle yenmek, baskın çıkmak.

definition: To cause someone to feel sympathy or emotion.
examples: Her story struck a chord with many listeners.
The film struck a chord with audiences worldwide.
notes: Birinin duygularına dokunmak.

definition: Attracted or pulled towards something.
examples: Many writers were drawn to transcendentalism.
She felt drawn to the city’s vibrant culture.
notes: Çekilmek, ilgi duymak.

definition: To spread throughout something.
examples: The smell of coffee permeated the room.
Ideas of freedom began to permeate the society.
notes: Bir şeye yayılmak, nüfuz etmek.

definition: Having a liking or interest towards something or someone.
examples: Many were attracted to Emerson’s ideas.
She was attracted to his kindness.
notes: Bir şeye veya kişiye ilgi duymak.

definition: Strong feeling of dislike or disapproval.
examples: He expressed disgust over the unfair treatment.
There was public disgust over the corruption scandal.
notes: Tiksinti, hoşlanmama.

definition: The state of being important or famous.
examples: Margaret Fuller came to prominence as a leading transcendentalist.
The artist gained prominence after the exhibition.
notes: Öne çıkma, ün kazanma.

definition: A person with very great intelligence.
examples: He was regarded as a towering intellect in philosophy.
Her towering intellect inspired many students.
notes: Yüksek zeka, üstün akıl.

definition: Resulting from an irresistible urge.
examples: He has a compulsive habit of checking his phone.
Compulsive behaviors can be hard to control.
notes: Kontrol edilemeyen dürtüsel.

definition: A story, often one that is imaginative or traditional.
examples: The old man told a fascinating tale.
Fairy tales often have magical creatures.
notes: Masal, hikaye.

definition: A very focused and determined search or mission.
examples: Captain Ahab’s single-minded quest was to kill the white whale.
Her single-minded quest for success inspired everyone.
notes: Tek amaçlı, kararlı arayış.

definition: Capable of producing abundant vegetation or crops.
examples: The region has fertile soil ideal for farming.
Fertile lands produce higher crop yields.
notes: Verimli, ürün vermeye elverişli (toprak için).

definition: Plants that are grown for food or other agricultural purposes.
examples: Farmers harvest their crops in the fall.
Rice and wheat are common staple crops.
notes: Tarım ürünleri, ekin.

definition: Land used to grow crops.
examples: Much of the region’s cropland is irrigated.
Cropland is shrinking due to urban expansion.
notes: Tarla, ekili arazi.

definition: Not appropriate or fitting for a particular purpose or situation.
examples: This dry land is ill-suited for rice farming.
His personality was ill-suited to leadership.
notes: Uygun olmayan, elverişsiz.

definition: To grow or develop well or vigorously.
examples: Plants thrive in a nutrient-rich environment.
Some businesses thrive even in tough economic times.
notes: Gelişmek, serpilmek, başarılı olmak.

word: the nutrient solution flows constantly past the roots of the plants
definition: A method in which liquid nutrients continuously move around plant roots.
examples: In hydroponics, the nutrient solution flows constantly past the roots of the plants.
This system ensures that the plants receive oxygen and nutrients at all times.
notes: Besin çözeltisi sürekli olarak bitki köklerinin etrafında dolaşır.

definition: Purified water that has been boiled into vapor and condensed back into liquid.
examples: They used distilled water in the hydroponic system.
Distilled water is free from minerals and impurities.
notes: Damıtılmış, saf su.

word: facilities can be located in or near cities
definition: Farming or production centers can be placed close to urban areas.
examples: Hydroponic facilities can be located in or near cities to reduce transportation costs.
Urban farms are facilities located near city centers.
notes: Tesisler şehir içinde veya yakınında konumlandırılabilir.

definition: Farmers have the ability to cultivate food plants.
examples: With hydroponics, farmers can grow crops year-round.
Farmers can grow crops indoors without soil.
notes: Çiftçiler ürün yetiştirebilir.

definition: Types of edible plants used for flavor or nutrition.
examples: They grow fresh herbs and vegetables in their backyard.
Hydroponics is ideal for growing herbs and vegetables like basil and lettuce.
notes: Otlar ve sebzeler.

definition: Basic food crops that are grown in large quantities and form the main part of a diet.
examples: Wheat, rice, and corn are staple crops around the world.
Staple crops provide most of the population’s calories.
notes: Temel gıda ürünleri.

definition: The process of growing plants for food or other uses.
examples: Soil preparation is essential for successful cultivation.
The cultivation of tomatoes has increased in recent years.
notes: Tarım, ekim-dikim.

definition: Absolutely necessary or essential.
examples: Clean water is vital for plant growth.
It is vital to follow safety procedures in the lab.
notes: Hayati, çok önemli.

definition: Water that contains essential nutrients for plant growth.
examples: Hydroponic systems use nutrient-rich water instead of soil.
The plants absorb minerals from the nutrient-rich water.
notes: Besin maddeleri açısından zengin su.
